name: Hilton Phuket Arcadia Resort & Spa

reviews.title: beautiful hotel
reviews.text: Most has already been said by other reviewers. What I am going to add is what I have not seen written by others. We stayed for our honeymoon for two weeks here.

reviews.title: Better then Expected, but still to expensive!
reviews.text: The check-in was very fast.

reviews.title: Huge hotel
reviews.text: Pools. The hotel has three pools, two of which have two sections, an upper and a lower connected via waterfalls and slides. The horizon pool closest to the beach is the smallest, yet the only one with deep section where you can dive. Basic free scuba lessons are also given at this pool. The shallow parts of different pools have different depths.

reviews.title: Fantastic hotel! Highly recommend!
reviews.text: Rooms. I asked to see different rooms during my visit, partially because I wanted to know what room I can choose next time. There are three wings with their rooms called Andaman, Saitong and Lotus wings. The buildings were built about 25, 10, and 7 years ago, respectively, and the older the wing, the lower the rate. The Lotus rooms are larger than the other two. They have newer furniture and are most expensive. To be honest, I did not see any reason why would anyone not choose Andaman rooms. The only thing was lack of separate showers and bathtubs there. I personally do not like baths and we never used it. One should bear in mind that I had very short visit to the other rooms (Lotus and Andaman). We had a cockroach in our room one night. Also the drain of the sink became very slow, which we did not bother to mention. Nevertheless, there might be more significant differences between different room types, which we could not detect. We were not disturbed by this but I can imagine that some guests would. The TV sets were rather old in all types of rooms, but again we did not care.

reviews.title: Amazing Amazing Amazing!!!
reviews.text: Have just come back from the Hilton Arcadia in Phuket. (stayed from 21st Dec 2008 till 3rd Jan 2009) There was a large group of us about 6 adults and about 10 kids all ranging from ages 7 to 19.

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: Ok when we arrived we all thought oh my god it is so big we will never get to know our way around but there are 3 wings, we were in the Andaman wing which is where it is all happening so we were pleased that we had booked this wing. The Saitong and Lotus wing is quieter and from what i have heard the rooms are nicer looking but we had 3 in a room and it was absolutely fine. The grounds are fabulous very well kept and the food is excellent especially breakfast as there is so much choice. During the day we sunbathed at the Horizon Pool which is the nearest pool to the beach. The beach is just across the road and even though the road is busy there was a guard who took you across so no problems there. The Hilton Hotel is based in Karon which is not as big as Phuket but is a lot more civilised with really good restaurants everywhere. We did go to Patong which was really busy and full of traffic - but you have to go there to experience it!!!! especially Bangler Street!!! (plenty of Lady Boys).

reviews.title: Good but let down by a rude receptionist

Nice Relaxing Weekend
reviews.text: We really liked our room in the Lotus Wing. Considering that two of my kids were 3 and under, the hotel readily agreed to let us all stay in one room. They pushed the 2 queen-sized beds together and gave us a 3rd single bed (which we didn't use). The room was lovely, and had a decent view of Karon Beach and the Andaman Sea.

None of the hotels along Karon Beach have direct access to the beach, as there is a 2-lane (sometimes busy) road that separates the beach from the buildings. Though we would have preferred direct beach access, this wasn't a problem. The public Karon Beach gets busy after 11am, but not as crowded as Patong. You can rent deck chairs and umbrella for 200 baht (per party, I believe) for the whole day. Just plop yourself down on an empty chair, and someone will find you for payment. There're also masseurs who operate from tents along the back of the beach. 250 baht for 30mins. Very relaxing with the cool sea breeze and sounds of the waves.

reviews.text: We highly recommend the hotel's Thai Thai restaurant -- great food, good service. Thai Thai had a wider selection of vegetarian options than we encountered at other eateries in Phuket. Unfortunately they only open at 6pm for dinner.
reviews.title: Magnificent never wanted to leave!

description: The resort is located on the island’s west coast and offers a range of fun and relaxation options for parents and children alike. The resort sprawls over 75-acres landscaped gardens, right on the golden sands of Karon Beach. The resort is conveniently located to four world-class golf courses, elephant riding, scuba diving, ancient golden temples and an abundance of shopping areas. It is the place that you’d rather be with your family for next holiday.
